feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Additional Ledgers - Automatic Creation
entry.content:
Hello all,

I hope all of you are doing great and will support and help on the following query:

I along with our team are reviewing the ledger architecture behavior in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, specifically regarding the automatic creation of additional ledgers (Extension / Commitment ledgers) upon scope item activation.

Based on our analysis and current system behavior, we understand that the following scope items trigger the creation of additional ledgers:

4GQ – Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Project-Based Sales → 2L (Extension Ledger)

1IL – Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Project-Based Services → 2L (Extension Ledger)

1K2 – Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Sell from Stock → 2L (Extension Ledger)

3M3 – Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Service Documents → 2L (Extension Ledger)

2FD – Predictive Accounting for Sales Orders → 2L (Extension Ledger)

4V7 – Predictive Accounting for Service Contract Management → 2L (Extension Ledger)

2I3 – Predictive Commitments Management → 0E (Commitment / Prediction Ledger)

3L3 – Contract Accounting – Contract-Based Revenue Recognition → 2L (Extension Ledger)

We kindly request your support and guidance on the following:

Are there any additional scope items, beyond those listed above, that result in the automatic creation of additional ledgers (e.g., 2L or 0E) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud?

Can you confirm that all other scope items do not create additional ledgers and post exclusively to the leading ledger (0L)?

Is the creation of the management accounting ledger (0C) system-driven and not directly tied to the activation of individual scope items?

This clarification is important for all of us to ensure consistent scope activation decisions across projects and to avoid unintended ledger creation during tenant provisioning.

We appreciate all your support and guidance on this matter as I am sure it will help all the members too.

entry.title: Product Cost Collector - Functional Area (Public Cloud)
entry.content:
Dears,

we started using the Product Cost Collectors and we wonder where does the default value for Functional are comes from on the "Header" tab.  

When we create a new PCC, the Functional area is automatically filled and "grayed" so we can't change it. It doesn't seem that it's taken from the Product (as the product is connected to a routing - the cost centers in the routing have different functional areas filled)

Can we configure other defautl value for the PCC?

Thank you
Pavel

entry.title: How to retrieve open AR items including partial payments in Custom CDS View (same as F0711)?
entry.content:
Title:
How to retrieve open AR items including partial payments in Custom CDS View (same as F0711)?
Body:
Objective:
I need to create a custom CDS view that retrieves the same open AR line items as the standard Fiori app F0711 (Manage Customer Line Items) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
Current Situation:
I'm using I_JournalEntryOperationalView as the primary data source with the following WHERE clause:


ClearingDate = '00000000'
AND IsOpenItemManaged = 'X'
AND (AccountingDocumentType = 'RV'
OR AccountingDocumentType = 'DR')
```

**Problem:**
This condition works for most cases, but **it excludes items with partial payments**. When a partial payment is posted, the `ClearingDate` field gets populated (e.g., '20230713'), even though the item still has an outstanding balance.

**Example:**
- Journal Entry: 1800000000
- Line Item: 000001
- `ClearingDate`: '20230713' (not '00000000')
- `IsOpenItemManaged`: 'X'
- Status in F0711: **Open (Clearing Status = 2)**
- Status in my CDS View: **Excluded** (due to ClearingDate filter)

**Question:**
Which field(s) should I use to correctly identify open items including partially cleared items, matching the logic of F0711?

I've tried:
- `ClearingJournalEntry` (empty check)
- `ClearingAccountingDocument` (empty check)
- `ReceivableFinancingStatus` (not populated in our system)

**Additional Info:**
- System: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
- Data Source: `I_JournalEntryOperationalView`
- Fiori App: F0711 - Manage Customer Line Items

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Calculating surcharges on contract manufacturing
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to calculate a material with surcharges that has a contract manufacturing component. The value is taken from an info record for the calculation. The material has the special procurement key 30. When I calculate now, no surcharges are determined. If I remove Sobsl 30, surcharges are calculated, but subcontracting is no longer taken into account.

Does anyone have any idea why this might be?

entry.title: Update US Tax Rates error Valid from date of jur cd &1 is before valid from date in customizing
entry.content:
In Configuration Activity 101016 - Define Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases or App Upload Tax Rates (F2609) a tax rate needs to be created with validity date prior to that of existing tax rates. 

Error messages if an existing tax rate is changed in the past:

  1. Configuration Activity 101016 - Define Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases: “Valid from date of jur cd &1 is before valid from date in customizing”.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: SAP Certified - Implementation Consultant - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Financial Accounting
entry.content:
The SAP Certified - Implementation Consultant - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Financial Accounting course contains the following information advisory:

 “This SAP Certification Exam will be replaced with a practical exam by end of January. No exams can be scheduled after December 31st. Scheduling will be open again once the new exam version is available.”.

Please advise if it’s still ok to go ahead with the study or await the release of the new exam version? Not sure if this will affect the course content?

entry.title: SAP Cloud Identity Access Governance Access Request Status audit logs
entry.content:
Seeking advisory guidance on SAP Cloud Identity Access Governance (8010452)

The IAG customer would like to generate a report that shows access requests approved by an individual user or their team members.

In addition, they would like to view audit logs within the Access Request Status app. Is it possible to enable this?

Currently, the available IAG reports are administrative reports that display all access requests and therefore cannot be shared with business users.
